Name: market for butyl acetate | butyl acetate | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/17736/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'butyl acetate', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;butyl acetate'  is an organic substance with a CAS no. : 000123-86-4. It is called 'butyl acetate' under IUPAC naming and its molecular formula is: C6H12O2. It is liquid under normal conditions of temperature and pressure with no distinct odour. The substance is modelled as a pure substance. On a consumer level, is used in the following products: coating products, fillers, putties, plasters, modelling clay, washing & cleaning products, anti-freeze products, finger paints, lubricants and greases and biocides (e.g. disinfectants, pest control products). On industrial sites, the substance is used for the manufacture of products in the following sectors: printing and recorded media reproduction. This substance is used for the manufacture of: chemicals and textile, leather or fur.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'butyl acetate',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'butyl acetate',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
